text: A bornhardt () is a big dome-shaped, steep-sided, bald rock formation. They are a kind of inselberg. They are usually made up of granites or gneisses, but can sometimes be found in other rock types like limestone, sandstone and conglomerate. They are named after Wilhelm Bornhardt (1864â€“1946), the German geologist who first described the feature. ==References== ==More reading== * * ==Other websites== *Granite Inselbergs of the Central Namib Deserts *Boulders/Tors/Inselbergs Category:Rock formations
title: Bornhardt
